settings.name: Commonly Used.files.autoSave
settings.description: Controls auto save of dirty files. Accepted values:  'off', 'afterDelay', 'onFocusChange' (editor loses focus), 'onWindowChange' (window loses focus). If set to 'afterDelay', you can configure the delay in 'files.autoSaveDelay'.
enumDescriptions: A dirty file is never automatically saved.
A dirty file is automatically saved after the configured 'files.autoSaveDelay'.
A dirty file is automatically saved when the editor loses focus.
A dirty file is automatically saved when the window loses focus.

settings.name: Commonly Used.editor.fontSize
settings.description: Controls the font size in pixels.

settings.name: Commonly Used.editor.tabSize
settings.description: The number of spaces a tab is equal to. This setting is overridden based on the file contents when `editor.detectIndentation` is on.

settings.name: Commonly Used.editor.renderWhitespace
settings.description: Controls how the editor should render whitespace characters, possibilities are 'none', 'boundary', and 'all'. The 'boundary' option does not render single spaces between words.

settings.name: Commonly Used.editor.cursorStyle
settings.description: Controls the cursor style, accepted values are 'block', 'block-outline', 'line', 'line-thin', 'underline' and 'underline-thin'

settings.name: Commonly Used.editor.multiCursorModifier
settings.description: The modifier to be used to add multiple cursors with the mouse. `ctrlCmd` maps to `Control` on Windows and Linux and to `Command` on macOS. The Go To Definition and Open Link mouse gestures will adapt such that they do not conflict with the multicursor modifier.
enumDescriptions: Maps to `Control` on Windows and Linux and to `Command` on macOS.
Maps to `Alt` on Windows and Linux and to `Option` on macOS.

settings.name: Commonly Used.editor.insertSpaces
settings.description: Insert spaces when pressing Tab. This setting is overridden based on the file contents when `editor.detectIndentation` is on.

settings.name: Commonly Used.files.exclude
settings.description: Configure glob patterns for excluding files and folders. For example, the files explorer decides which files and folders to show or hide based on this setting.
